column4: is there any msn client or plugin for linux that displays activity log per user? (logins/logouts/name changes/status changes)
similarly to msn plus
probably
also theres Kmess and Mercury Messenger a closed source Java app, made by only one guy
try them or find out about them.  also I think there will be a plugin for PIdgin
and MSN plus is a load of rubbish,  it  tends to put spyware or other rubbish on peoples computers as well, even if they say no to the sponser program
it's good your looking into alternatives, but there is a way you can have MSN plus  in Ubuntu well kind of

no not WIne,  a Windows virtual machine instead.  and yes I know Windows LIve Messenger or both with MSN plus,  would be a sucky reason for a virtual machine  or even  to use Wine if they would work there
lol your running  Ubuntu inside Windows?
well good for trying, but then you should partition your hard disk for a real install latero n
oh you got wireless?
your running wireless?
yes the ethernet should just work

wireless is the one people tend to get issues with, hence why I was asking.  if you had wireless working in  WIndows, and you were running a virtual machine of Ubuntu, then sure it could be working, but then maybe it won't  in a proper install
yeah  put 9.04 on for real, and do Ext4 as the partition.  Ext4 is pretty new,  no  Ext4 in 8.10
partition?  yes the file system for it
9.04 is next Ubuntu released at the end of April

more experiended users such as myself,  get it  early and use development versions,  but that is not recommended to new users ever!  since bugs.   Have you done Kubuntu yet by the way?  How about Xubuntu?

I don't like KDE4 as a GUI,  KDE3 was nice, but sadly they don't make that anymore :(  KDE3 been around for years very nice and stable.   it's not an option in 8.10 though from the repo.  can have both from repo in 8.04.   I do however like some of KDE's apps that I will run in Gnome :)   Xubuntu is like a light waight version of Gnome,  check it out

Xubuntu uses XFCE,  XFCE is only really a windowmanager/gui   however  if you do this in terminal:  sudo apt-get install xubuntu-desktop  that will put  XFCE on as well as  nice apps such as Abiword,  which could be just run in Gnome or KDE anyway
heh I could tell you loads of good apps to install :)
nice :) so I guess at the oment you have to shut down using system menu :)
or terminal
or use from system menu :)  or set panels back to default
